title: How to Wrap a Baby Sling

steps.title: Fold your sling.
steps.content: Fold your sling. Before you can master the different methods for wrapping your baby in a sling, you need to learn how to fold and secure the sling itself. If your sling does not have rings, you’ll cross the fabric and secure it with a knot. To begin, fold the entire length of the fabric so that it isn’t as wide. Do not twist the sling. You want it smooth and even.

steps.title: Wrap the sling against your stomach.
steps.content: Wrap the sling against your stomach. Take the folded fabric and wrap it against your stomach. Check the placement – you want the middle of the fabric to be hugging your stomach. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Criss-cross the sling around your back.
steps.content: Criss-cross the sling around your back. Bring the ends of the fabric, criss-crossed, around your back, so that the crossed ends come over your shoulders and hang over your chest. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Criss-cross the sling around your front.
steps.content: Criss-cross the sling around your front. Take the ends of the fabric hanging over your chest and cross them again, tucking each end under and through the fabric on your waist.

steps.title: Wrap the sling around your back again.
steps.content: Wrap the sling around your back again. Bring the ends of the fabric around your back again. Note that if your fabric is still too long, you can repeat this process, bringing the sling around your front and back until it’s a good length to tie in a knot.

steps.title: Secure the sling with a knot.
steps.content: Secure the sling with a knot. Tie the ends together in a knot, and smooth out any crumples and creases.

steps.title: Position the sling.
steps.content: Position the sling. If your sling has rings, the process for setting it up is a bit different. First, put the side of the sling with the rings along the shoulder opposite to the hip or arm you typically use to carry your child. In other words, if you usually carry your baby on your right side, then set the rings on your left shoulder. Let the part of the sling without rings fall freely down your back. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open your sling.
steps.content: Open your sling. Spread the sling out completely.

steps.title: Bring the sling under your arm.
steps.content: Bring the sling under your arm. Take the end of the sling without rings, which has fallen down your back, and bring it to your front by passing it under your arm. Spread the sling again. [4] X Research source Make sure, at this point, that the sling isn’t twisted on your back.

steps.title: Pass the end of the sling through both rings.
steps.content: Pass the end of the sling through both rings. Grasp the end of the sling and wrinkle it so that it will fit, then pass it through both rings. Note that these rings are functional; you can customize the size of the sling to fit your child’s age and size.

steps.title: Secure the sling.
steps.content: Secure the sling. Bring the end of the sling back over the top ring and down through the bottom ring. Check to see that you can tighten it by pulling on the end. Once the sling is secured, you don’t have to untie it. You can simply remove it as is, hang it up, and, when you wear it again, adjust the size as needed.

steps.title: Open your sling.
steps.content: Open your sling. For newborns and babies up to a year old, the cradle hold position works well. Starting with the basic wrap, you’ll have two layers of fabric across your chest. Pull on one layer, and it will open like a pouch. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put your baby’s feet in the sling.
steps.content: Put your baby’s feet in the sling. Hold your baby against your shoulder, lean back a little, and slip his or her feet in the sling, toward your midsection.

steps.title: Position your baby.
steps.content: Position your baby. Turn your baby so that his or her arm and side are resting against your body; then, slowly lower your baby’s bottom on the pouch. [6] X Research source Make sure that your baby is facing the opening of the pouch.

steps.title: Finish the wrap.
steps.content: Finish the wrap. Take the fabric around your waist and pull it over your baby’s body.

steps.title: Get in position.
steps.content: Get in position. Starting with the basic wrap, hold your baby against your chest, either facing you (for the chest-to-chest position) or facing out (for the back-to-chest position).

steps.title: Position your baby’s feet.
steps.content: Position your baby’s feet. Pull on the fabric across your shoulder and slip one of your baby’s feet on one side of the fabric and the other on the opposite side. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tuck your baby’s legs.
steps.content: Tuck your baby’s legs. Carefully tuck your baby’s legs under the fabric that’s wrapped around your waist.

steps.title: Secure your baby.
steps.content: Secure your baby. Pull on the fabric around your waist and stretch it up to your baby’s neck, making sure to keep the fabric under your baby’s bottom. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Lay your wrap on a flat surface.
steps.content: Lay your wrap on a flat surface. This position should be used only for toddlers. If your baby is over a year old and mobile, start by placing your sling on a bed or other flat surface.

steps.title: Position your baby.
steps.content: Position your baby. Place your baby on the sling. Make sure that the width of the sling is spread from his or her knees to his or her armpits.

steps.title: Put your baby on your back.
steps.content: Put your baby on your back. Sit in front of your baby’s feet, facing away. Reach for both ends of the fabric, and pull them toward you, bring your baby against your back like a backpack. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Position the sling.
steps.content: Position the sling. Pull both ends of the fabric up and over your shoulders, then across your chest and around your midsection. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the sling.
steps.content: Secure the sling. Bring the ends of the fabric to your back. Secure it with a knot under your baby’s bottom.
